Tool ID::Short description: A graphical tool to annotate sentences in dependency syntax
Tool ID::Additional features: git-support (automatic gid add/git commit; automatic generation of transliteration of non-Latin scripts into Latin-script (Translit= fields in MISC and trainsliteration of the entire sentence; statistics (number/percentage of UPOSes, deprels, etc). The tool can be used as a frontend to an parser which returns the result in CoNLL-U format

Tool ID::Short description: A web-based collaborative tool for linguistic annotation that supports various annotation tasks, including POS tagging, dependency parsing, and coreference resolution. It provides collaborative features and works well with formats like CoNLL-U.
User Experience::Collaborative annotatio: ['annotators working independently on their own annotations of the same data', 'annotators working together on the same shared annotation of the data.']
Tool ID::Additional features: WebAnno supports a rich set of features including customizable annotation layers, integration with external data sources, support for multiple annotators, and visualization of annotated data. It also supports automatic pre-annotation and inter-annotator agreement calculation
